newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian ATX extends bull run to fresh high.
newsitem.headline: Austrian ATX extends bull run to fresh high.

text.p: Austria's ATX climbed 1.04 percent to a fresh record close on Wednesday, boosted by the strong dollar and a positive international environment.

Vienna airport company Flughafen Wien led the way on brisk turnover of 138,507 lots. Traders said its shares were benefitting from recent "buy" recommendations, surging 6.10 percent to 557 schillings.
"The mood is right. There is lively interest for certain stocks and the 1,500-level is within reach for the ATX," one market participant said.
"This market can run and run and run," said another.
The ATX index finished 15.14 points up at 1,474.01, having touched an intra-day high of 1,477.15. It was the ATX's highest close since the index was recalculated in January, 1991.

Flughafen Wien was the top gainer, followed by preferred shares in bank Creditanstalt, up 4.08 percent at 606.70 schillings on heavy volume. Earlier Creditanstalt hit a new year high of 611 schillings.
Industrial group Radex-Heraklith, which presents its half-year earnings on Thursday firmed one schilling to 561.
The leading loser was paper maker Leykam, whose Dutch parent KNP BT also details half-year figures on Thursday. Leykam shares slipped 1.48 pct at 343.85 schillings.
August ATX futures stood 16.7 points up at 1,477.5 on 1,215 contracts. The broad-based Vienna bourse index rose 4.17 points, or 0.8 pct, to 525.85.
